div.p: The event handler signature needs to match the event trigger definition argument count. If the event handler takes two arguments, the event trigger must be able to provide two arguments.

div.class: rt-Box py-4 gap-4 flex flex-col w-full
rt-Box flex flex-col p-6 rounded-xl overflow-x-auto border border-slate-4 bg-slate-2 items-center justify-center w-full
rt-Flex rt-r-fd-column rt-r-ai-start rt-r-gap-3 rx-Stack css-1tehhj4

span.style: transform: var(--radix-slider-thumb-transform); position: absolute; left: calc(40% + 1.2px);

div.p: The event trigger here is on_value_commit and it is called when the value changes at the end of an interaction. This event trigger passes one argument, which is the value of the slider. The event handler which is triggered by the event trigger must therefore take one argument, which is value here.

div.class: rt-Box py-4 gap-4 flex flex-col w-full
rt-Box flex flex-col p-6 rounded-xl overflow-x-auto border border-slate-4 bg-slate-2 items-center justify-center w-full
rt-Flex rt-r-fd-column rt-r-ai-start rt-r-gap-3 rx-Stack css-zcxndt
rt-Flex rt-r-fd-column rt-r-ai-start rt-r-gap-3 rx-Stack css-zcxndt

button.class: rt-reset rt-BaseCheckboxRoot rt-CheckboxRoot rt-r-size-2 rt-variant-surface

input.name: check
input.style: position: absolute; pointer-events: none; opacity: 0; margin: 0px; transform: translateX(-100%); width: 16px; height: 20px;

button.class: rt-reset rt-BaseButton rt-r-size-2 rt-variant-solid rt-Button

div.p: In this example the event trigger is the on_submit event of the form. The event handler is handle_submit. The on_submit event trigger passes one argument, the form data as a dictionary, to the handle_submit event handler. The handle_submit event handler must take one argument because the on_submit event trigger passes one argument.
When the number of args accepted by an EventHandler differs from that provided by the event trigger, an EventHandlerArgMismatch error will be raised.

a.class: rt-Text rt-reset rt-Link rt-underline-none flex flex-row items-center gap-6 hover:!text-violet-11 text-slate-12 cursor-pointer mb-2 transition-colors group css-1macts

h2.class: rt-Heading rt-r-size-6 font-large lg:font-x-large scroll-m-[5rem] mt-8 css-134ffhx

a.h2: Pass Additional Arguments to Event Handlers

svg.class: lucide lucide-link !text-violet-11 invisible transition-[visibility_0.075s_ease-out] group-hover:visible mt-8

div.p: In some use cases, you want to pass additional arguments to your event handlers. To do this you can bind an event trigger to a lambda, which can call your event handler with the arguments you want.
Try typing a color in an input below and clicking away from it to change the color of the input.

div.class: rt-Box py-4 gap-4 flex flex-col w-full
rt-Box flex flex-col p-6 rounded-xl overflow-x-auto border border-slate-4 bg-slate-2 items-center justify-center w-full
rt-Flex rt-r-fd-row rt-r-ai-start rt-r-gap-3 rx-Stack css-zcxndt

div.p: In this case, in we want to pass two arguments to the event handler change_color, the color and the index of the color to change.
The on_blur event trigger passes the text of the input as an argument to the lambda, and the lambda calls the change_color event handler with the text and the index of the input.
When the number of args accepted by a lambda differs from that provided by the event trigger, an EventFnArgMismatch error will be raised.

button.class: AccordionTrigger css-bcpuhy

div.class: rt-Flex rt-r-fd-row rt-r-ai-start rt-r-gap-2 rx-Stack css-bkjhwu

div.p: Event Handler Parameters should provide type annotations.

a.class: rt-Text rt-reset rt-Link rt-underline-none flex flex-row items-center gap-6 hover:!text-violet-11 text-slate-12 cursor-pointer mb-2 transition-colors group css-1macts

h2.class: rt-Heading rt-r-size-6 font-large lg:font-x-large scroll-m-[5rem] mt-8 css-134ffhx

svg.class: lucide lucide-link !text-violet-11 invisible transition-[visibility_0.075s_ease-out] group-hover:visible mt-8

div.p: Event arguments in Reflex are passed positionally. Any additional arguments not passed to an EventHandler will be filled in by the event trigger when it is fired.
The following two code samples are equivalent:

span.span: # Use a lambda to pass event trigger args to the EventHandler.
# Create a partial that passes event trigger args for any args not provided to the EventHandler.
